definition: to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]

sentences.english: Goshawk circled in the mountains on the river surging with the cliffs.
sentences.chinese: 苍鹰在山峦上盘旋，江水随着绝壁激荡。

sentences.english: And throughout America the anguished debate roils on.
sentences.chinese: 在个美洲都激荡着这苦恼的争论。

sentences.english: Experts have celebrated the power of brainstorming and idea-generation techniques.
sentences.chinese: 专家们为脑力激荡和创意产生机制的威力拍手叫好。

sentences.english: Barbed these words, it was loudly stirring the eardrum.
sentences.chinese: 这些带刺的话语，响亮地激荡着耳鼓。

sentences.english: Let's brainstorm and see if we can come up with some new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 让我们脑力激荡一下看看能不能有新点子。

sentences.english: My creativity has blossomed through brainstorming sessions for speech topics.
sentences.chinese: 在演讲题目的脑力激荡过程，激发我的创意能力。

sentences.english: As that pressure builds, tectonic tremors can agitate chambers.
sentences.chinese: 当这种压力形成时，构造震动会引起岩浆室的激荡。

sentences.english: At present, impassioned souls embedded in my harp, weep in silence.
sentences.chinese: 这个时候，我的琴嵌入激荡的灵魂，无声泪流。

sentences.english: The team brainstormed the CAR response.
sentences.chinese: 这队有人提供脑力激荡或意见者。

sentences.english: With the world economic globalization, the future of China is suddenly enlightened.
sentences.chinese: 全球化以飓风之势激荡中国，炎黄的天空豁然开朗。

sentences.english: Facing these two opponent dicks, are you also stirred by sort of pleasure as amour?
sentences.chinese: 面对敌我两种关系，你是否也激荡过类似偷情的欢愉？

sentences.english: I never feel comfortable at our brainstorming sessions.
sentences.chinese: 每次脑力激荡的时候，我总是感到不舒服。

sentences.english: The liquid around me frothed and bubbled.
sentences.chinese: 四周的液体会因为激荡而泛起层层泡沫。

sentences.english: But it was France which thenceforth became the chief centre of the agitation.
sentences.chinese: 但它是法国，其中此后成为行政中心的激荡。

definition: to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
